originalTitle: Uganda's military chief denies army assaulted Bobi Wine's wife
title: A Friendly Story About Kindness and Truth in Uganda
content:
Hello, amazing friends all across Africa! It's your friendly news reporter, here to share a story from a beautiful country called Uganda. We talk about important things that happen, but in a way that's easy to understand for everyone.

Meet Bobi Wine!

In Uganda, there's a very famous person named Bobi Wine. He used to be a super cool singer! Imagine singing awesome songs that everyone loves to dance to. Bobi Wine loves his country very much. He wants to help make Uganda a happy and fair place for everyone, especially children like you! He is what we call an 'opposition leader'. That means he wants to help lead the country and suggest good changes for how things are done. He speaks up for what he believes is right. Did you know? Uganda is called the 'Pearl of Africa' because it has so much beauty, like big lakes and amazing animals!

Meet Barbara, a Brave Lady!

Bobi Wine has a wonderful wife, and her name is Barbara Kyagulanyi. She is a very kind and strong lady. Barbara loves her husband and her family very much. She also cares deeply about Uganda, just like Bobi. She supports him in his work to help their country.

What is an Army?

Every country has an army. The army is made up of brave soldiers. Their big job is to protect everyone in the country. They work hard to keep people safe and make sure everything is peaceful. Soldiers wear uniforms and are trained to be strong and helpful. Uganda also has its own army, and they work to keep Uganda safe from harm. Did you know? Soldiers train very hard to be strong and helpful, sometimes learning many different skills!

A Visit to Barbara's Home

One day, something happened at Barbara's house. Some people from the army visited her home. Bobi Wine, her husband, was not there at that time. He was somewhere else, maybe working or resting. The people from the army wanted to know where Bobi Wine was. They asked Barbara to tell them where her husband was. This was a bit of a serious moment for Barbara and her family. Simple explanation: When we say 'whereabouts', it just means 'where someone is' or 'where they can be found'.

Barbara Says "No!"

Barbara is a brave lady. She told the army people that she would not tell them where Bobi Wine was. She chose not to share his secret. She felt it was important to protect her husband. Barbara later said that she felt very worried and scared during this time. She said that the soldiers were not very kind to her when she would not tell them what they wanted to know. She felt like they were trying to hurt her or make her afraid. Simple explanation: To 'assault' means to hurt someone, or to make them feel very scared and unsafe with your actions or words.

What the Army Chief Said

After Barbara told her story, the head of the army in Uganda spoke out. He is called the military chief. He said that the army did not hurt Barbara. He said that the soldiers did not do anything bad to her when they visited her house. He said that the army always tries to be good and kind to everyone. He said that Barbara's story about being hurt was not true. He denied that any harm was done to her. Simple explanation: When someone 'denies' something, it means they say it did not happen, or that the story someone else is telling is not true.

Why Are There Two Stories?

So, we have two different stories! Barbara says one thing happened, and the army chief says something different. Sometimes, in life, different people see things in different ways, or remember them differently. It's like when you and your friend play, and you both remember different parts of the game or who won! Did you know? It's always good to listen to everyone's story carefully and try to understand different points of view.

Why is This Story Important for Us?

This story reminds us that it's very important to be kind to everyone, always. It's also important to tell the truth. Everyone should feel safe in their home and their country, especially children. People in charge, like army chiefs and leaders, have a big job to make sure everyone is treated fairly and kindly. We hope that everyone in Uganda can live happily and safely, and that leaders and people work together with kindness and honesty. Let's all try to be kind and truthful every day! Did you know? Being kind makes the world a better, happier place for everyone to live in!
summary: Uganda's army chief says his soldiers did not hurt Bobi Wine's wife, Barbara, who had said they tried to make her tell where her husband was.
whyMatters: This story is important because everyone, especially kids, should know that people in charge must always be kind and truthful, and everyone has a right to feel safe and protected in their home.

originalTitle: People cling to treetops as 'worst floods in a generation' sweep Mozambique
title: Big Water Everywhere! Friends Help in Mozambique!
content:
Hello, Friends from Across Africa!

Hi everyone! It's your friendly news reporter for Africa here. Today, we have a very important story from our neighbour, Mozambique. Have you ever seen a lot, a lot of water? Sometimes, when it rains too much, there is water everywhere! This is called a flood.

What Happened in Mozambique?

Imagine your street turning into a big river! That's what happened in some parts of Mozambique. There was so much rain, and the water kept rising and rising. It was like the ocean decided to come visit the land! Sometimes, big, heavy clouds bring lots and lots of rain for many days. When it rains too much, the rivers get very full. Then, the water spills out over the land, covering everything. This made it very hard for people to get around. Homes got filled with water, and roads disappeared under the water. * **Did you know?** Mozambique is a beautiful country in Africa. It has a very long coastline with lovely beaches!

Water, Water Everywhere!

The water was so high that it covered many fields and even houses. It was very, very scary for the people living there. Some people had to climb onto the highest things they could find, like big, strong trees! They held on tight, waiting for help to come. Imagine being up in a tree, with water all around you. It must have felt very strange, a little bit cold, and certainly a bit frightening. They waited patiently, hoping for someone to find them and bring them to safety. * **Did you know?** Trees are very helpful! Their strong roots hold the soil, and their branches can be a safe place during floods.

The "Worst Floods in a Generation"

When we say "the worst floods in a generation," it means this kind of big, big water has not happened for a very, very long time. Maybe not even when your grandparents were little kids! It means it was a truly big event, much bigger than usual. This kind of big flood can cause a lot of trouble. So, it was a very tough time for the people of Mozambique. People had to leave their homes very quickly because of the fast-rising water. * **Did you know?** A "generation" means about 20-30 years! So, these floods were bigger than any in a very long time.

Friends Come to Help!

But guess what? When tough things happen, friends always come to help! People from far away countries heard about the big water in Mozambique. They wanted to lend a hand. Teams came from Brazil, which is a country very far across the ocean. Teams also came from our neighbours, South Africa! And even from a country called the UK, which is also very far away. They traveled very far, showing how much they cared. It shows that even though we live in different places, we can still care for each other. * **Did you know?** Helping others in need makes everyone feel good! It's called being a good global citizen.

Who Are the Helpers?

These helpers are very brave people! They are called rescue teams, and they are like real-life superheroes! They have special boats that can move through the water, even when it's deep. They also have big helicopters that fly high in the sky. These helicopters can see where people are stuck and can lift them to safety. Imagine a helicopter coming down to pick you up from a tree! What an amazing sight! They worked day and night to find people who needed help, bringing them to safe, dry land. * **Did you know?** Helicopters are amazing machines! They can go straight up and down, and hover in the air, which is perfect for rescues.

What Do Rescue Teams Do?

Rescue teams do many things. First, they look for people who are in danger. They use their special boats and helicopters to search everywhere, looking carefully for anyone who needs help. Then, they bring people to safe places like schools or community halls where it is dry. Sometimes, they bring food and clean water to people who are stuck. They also make sure people have blankets to stay warm and dry clothes if theirs got wet. Their job is to bring comfort and safety. They are real-life superheroes, helping to make sure everyone is safe and sound. They really care about making sure everyone gets to a safe, dry place. * **Did you know?** Clean water is super important after a flood because the flood water can sometimes make people sick if they drink it.

Life After the Big Water

After the big water goes down, it's still a lot of work. People need to clean their homes. Sometimes, homes are broken and need to be fixed or even rebuilt. But the good news is, all these helpers stay to make sure everyone gets back on their feet. They help to rebuild and make things better. It takes time, but people are strong. It can be sad for children when their toys get wet or their school is closed. But with help from friends, they can start smiling again soon and make their homes and communities happy again. * **Did you know?** Many people also donate clothes, blankets, and food to help those affected by floods. Every little bit helps!

How Can We Help?

Even though we are kids, we can still help! We can draw pictures of hope for the children in Mozambique. We can tell our parents about what happened and ask if our family can help by donating a little bit of money or clothes to organizations that are helping. Even a small drawing of a rainbow or a smiling sun can show children in Mozambique that we are thinking of them and wishing them well. The most important thing is to remember that we are all part of one big African family, and we care for each other. Sending kind thoughts and prayers also helps! * **Did you know?** Even a small act of kindness, like sharing your toy, can make someone's day brighter.

We Are Strong Together!

The people of Mozambique are very strong and brave. With the help of friends from all over the world, they will make their country beautiful and strong again. We send all our love and support to Mozambique! Remember, when we work together, we can overcome anything. Keep being kind, everyone!
summary: Big floods hit Mozambique, causing lots of water everywhere and forcing people to climb trees, but brave helpers from different countries are working hard to rescue people and make things better.
whyMatters: This is important because floods can be very scary and dangerous for people and their homes, but it also shows how we can all help each other when someone is in trouble, no matter where they are from.
